column2: 1. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.

column2: 4. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
5. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before the traffic light turns red.

column2: 6. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 7. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.

column8: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column10: only if you have an emergency.

column6: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 10. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column10: look into the right side mirror.

column4: they must stay on the right side of the divider

Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 17. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column6: only on the left and right side

column2: 19. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 21. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: The bus is about to stop.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: You must pass the school bus.

column8: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
